what: Candidates’ selection for a pool of donors
title: Candidate's selection
text: can also simulate selection wait list candidates pool donors, according given model (algorithm). function donor_recipient_pairs() allow us compute possible donor-recipient pairs according previously described kidney allocation algorithms. example use pool 70 donors (donors data frame available package) select wait list 500 transplant candidates (data frame also available package) Now can also compute new column estimated 5-year event (mortality graft failure) probability described Molnar et al.1 available application TxScore, function txscore():
code: # compute all possible donor-recipient pairs for each one of the donors according to ‘lima’ algorithm all_pairs <- donor_recipient_pairs(df.donors = donors,                       df.candidates = candidates,                       df.abs = cabs,                       algorithm = lima,                       n = 0,                       check.validity = FALSE)  # for loop to select 2 available candidates for a pool of donors used.candidates <- NULL result <- NULL for(i in 1: length(all_pairs)){   tmp <- all_pairs[[i]][!ID %in% used.candidates][1:2,]    result <- data.table::rbindlist(list(result, tmp))   used.candidates <- c(used.candidates, tmp$ID) }  # as a result we have all the selected donor-recipient pairs for a given pool of donors result #>       ID title: Candidate's selection
text: Input data used package’s functions, regarding either candidates donors information, provided user must exact format example data available. Moreover, {simK} package allows generate synthetic data candidates donors can used {histoc}.

title: How to use
text: default 2 candidates selected donor, although can define number candidates selected. Portuguese rules allocation kidneys deceased donor (PT model) based scoring system takes consideration: HLA mismatches donor transplant candidate, level immunization candidate, time dialysis, age difference donor transplant candidate. Total scores donor-recipient pairs given column ptsPT. Also, hipersensitized candidates (hiper()) (cPRA >85%, HI) prioritized candidates ordered corresponding score.
code: pts() #>     ID bg A1 A2 B1 B2 DR1 DR2 mmA mmB mmDR mmHLA age donor_age dialysis cPRA #> 1: 112  O  2 29 44 44   4  12   1   1    1     3  58        65      104    0 #> 2: 487  O  2 33 15 27  11   7   1   1    2     4  55        65      103    0 #>       HI ptsPT SP ptsHLA ptsPRA ptsage ptsdial urgent #> 1: FALSE  16.4  3      2      0      4    10.4      0 #> 2: FALSE  15.3  3      1      0      4    10.3      0

title: How to use
text: simplified version EuroTransplant Kidney Allocation System (ETKAS)4 first time kidney candidates 18 years old donated one kidneys can simulated et(). simulation donor, transplant candidates sorted : Senior Program (65+ years old candidates donor 65+ years) SP; Acceptable Mismatch Program (candidates cPRA >85% without HLA antibodies HLA’s donor) ; 000 HLA mismatches (candidates without HLA mismatches donor) mmHLA; ETKAS points pointsET. Final points eligible candidate obtained sum HLA points (et_mmHLA()), dialysis (et_dialysis()) points MMP points (et_mmp()).
code: et() #>     ID bg A1 A2 B1 B2 DR1 DR2 mmA mmB mmDR mmHLA age donor_age dialysis cPRA #> 1: 442  A  3 25  7 15  13   4   2   1    1     4  68        65       98    0 #> 2: 344  A  1  3 35 49   1   4   1   2    0     3  70        65       69    0 #>       HI pointsET SP AM #> 1: FALSE       98  1  0 #> 2: FALSE       69  1  0

title: How to use
text: United Kingdom (UK) deceased donor kidney allocation transplantation firstly based definition two ranked Tiers eligible candidates donor (Tier): Tier – patients match score = 10 cPRA = 100% time dialysis >7 years; Tier B – eligible patients. Within Tier , transplant candidates ordered matchability time dialysis. Transplant candidates within Tier B prioritized according point-based system computed 7 elements: Matchability (matchability) Time dialysis (dialysis) Donor-recipient risk index combinations (ric()) HLA match age combined (age mmHLA) Donor-recipient age difference (age donor_age) Total HLA mismatch (mmHLa) Blood group match (abo_uk()) function simulates allocation kidneys candidates’ waiting list kidney-transplants take consideration geographical criteria.
code: uk() #>     ID bg A1 A2 B1 B2 DR1 DR2 matchability mmA mmB mmDR mmHLA age donor_age #> 1: 324  O  1 11  8 35   3  13       1745.9   1   2    2     5  69        65 #> 2: 104  O  2  3  8 27   3   3       1745.9   1   2    2     5  45        65 #>    dialysis cPRA Tier pointsUK #> 1:       81    0    A     9999 #> 2:       66    0    A     9999

title: How to use
text: Within model, color prioritization (cp()) waiting list transplant candidates established. Transplant candidates classified according clinical urgency (red color), regarding time dialysis cPRA value cPRA. orange color marked patients cPRA >85% time dialysis higher waiting time 3rd quartile. yellow classified patients cPRA >50% time dialysis higher waiting time median. , green classified rest. Within color group candidates ordered mmHLA (ascendant) time dialisys (descendant). Also, candidates allocated donors within age group (old old program) (SP), mimicking EuroTransplant senior program (sp()).
code: lima() #>     ID bg A1 A2 B1 B2 DR1 DR2 mmA mmB mmDR mmHLA age donor_age dialysis cPRA #> 1: 112  O  2 29 44 44   4  12   1   1    1     3  58        60      104    0 #> 2: 487  O  2 33 15 27  11   7   1   1    2     4  55        60      103    0 #>       HI     cp SP urgent #> 1: FALSE Orange  0      0 #> 2: FALSE Orange  0      0

title: Grantham distance metric. — dst
text: Grantham score attempts predict distance two amino acids, evolutionary sense. lower Grantham score reflects less evolutionary distance. higher Grantham score reflects greater evolutionary distance.

title: Grantham distance metric. — dst
text: 20x20 matrix rows amino acid columns amino acid

title: Grantham distance metric. — dst
text: https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.185.4154.862

title: Equity matrix algorithm — eqm
text: algorithm apply deceased donor's Kidney allocation transplantation. Ordering wait listed candidates given donor according utility-justice matrix.

title: Equity matrix algorithm — eqm
code: eqm(   iso = TRUE,   dABO = "O",   dA = c("1", "2"),   dB = c("15", "44"),   dDR = c("1", "4"),   donor.age = 60,   df.abs = cabs,   data = candidates,   n = 2,   q2 = 60,   q3 = 80,   uj.matx = uj_matx(),   SP = FALSE,   AM = FALSE,   mm000 = FALSE,   check.validity = FALSE )

title: Equity matrix algorithm — eqm
text: iso logical value ABO isogroupal compatibility. dABO character value donor's ABO blood group (O, , B, AB). dA two elements character vector donor's HLA-typing. dB two elements character vector donor's HLA-B typing. dDR two elements character vector donor's HLA-DR typing. donor.age numeric value donor's age. df.abs data frame candidates' antibodies. data data frame containing demographics medical information group waitlisted transplant candidates. n positive integer slice first candidates. q2 numerical value median candidates' waiting list (0 - 120). q3 numerical value third quartile candidates' waiting list (0 - 120). uj.matx 6 6 matrix obtained uj_matx(). SP logical value, TRUE donors 65+ years old allocated prioritize 65+ candidates,similarly Senior Program. logical value, TRUE hipersensitized candidates prioritize, similarly Acceptable mismatch program. mm000 logical value, TRUE candidates 0 HLA mismatchs donor prioritize. check.validity Logical decide whether validate input arguments.

title: Equity matrix algorithm — eqm
text: ordered data frame column ptsEQM (points utility-justice matrix), SP, HI mmHLA.

title: Equity matrix algorithm — eqm
